Name: Managua
Description: The capital region, known for being the political, cultural, and economic center of Nicaragua.

Name: Chinandega
Description: A region in the northwest known for its agricultural production, including sugarcane and bananas.

Name: León
Description: Known for its colonial architecture, historical significance, and the city of León, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Name: Masaya
Description: Known for its cultural traditions, artisan markets, and the Masaya Volcano National Park.

Name: Rivas
Description: A coastal region known for its tourism, beaches like San Juan del Sur, and the beautiful Lake Cocibolca.

Name: Estelí
Description: Known for its tobacco production, including world-famous cigars, and its cool, mountainous climate.

Name: Nueva Segovia
Description: A northern region known for its coffee plantations, mountainous terrain, and proximity to the Honduran border.

Name: Matagalpa
Description: Known for its coffee production, cool weather, and beautiful mountainous landscapes.

Name: Chontales
Description: Known for its cattle ranching and agriculture, particularly its production of rice and sugarcane.

Name: Boaco
Description: A region in central Nicaragua known for its agricultural activities and the city of Boaco.

Name: Rio San Juan
Description: Known for its rivers, natural reserves, and the San Juan River, which serves as a major waterway between Nicaragua and Costa Rica.
